text: Progesterone suppression of pregnancy lymphocytes is not mediated by glucocorticoid effect .
This study investigated whether the suppressive effect of progesterone on pregnancy lymphocytes is mediated by specific progesterone receptors .

The effects of a competitive progesterone antagonist ( RU486 ) and a specific <extra_id_0> glucocorticoid receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> blocker ( RU43044 ) were tested on the release of a blocking factor by progesterone - treated pregnancy lymphocytes .
RU 486 tested at an equal concentration as progesterone significantly inhibited the production of the blocking factor , while RU 43044 was without effect .
These data suggest that in pregnancy , lymphocyte progesterone acts on specific progesterone receptors and glucocorticoid binding sites are not involved .
